required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multiple Ascending Dose Safety Study of ShK-186 (Dalazatide) in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Multiple Ascending Dose Study of the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of ShK-186

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine safety outcomes in healthy volunteers after systemic administration of multiple ascending doses of dalazatide.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine safety outcomes in healthy volunteers after systemic administration of multiple ascending doses of dalazatide delivered via subcutaneous injection twice per week for a total of 9 doses.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to Day 57 (14 time points)

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects with changes in vital signs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization through Day 57 (14 time points)
secondary_outcome.description: Vital signs include temperature, respiratory rate, supine blood pressure and pulse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects with changes in symptom-directed physical examinations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization to day 57 (14 timepoints)
From date of randomization to day 57 (5 timepoints)
pre-dose, 15 minutes post dose, 30 minutes post dose, 1 hour post dose, 2 hours post dose, 4 hours post dose, 8 hours post dose, 12 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Parameters include Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve of dalazatide (AUC)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization through Day 57 (4 timepoints).
secondary_outcome.description: Serum evaluated for specific anti-drug antibody using ELISA-based immunoassay.

arm_group.description: 8 subjects, 6 given active agent and 2 given placebo
8 subjects, 6 given active agent and 2 given placebo
8 subjects, 6 given active agent and 2 given placebo
8 subjects, 6 given active agent and 2 given placebo

intervention.description: Different doses of drug, subcutaneous injection twice per week for a total of 9 doses.
Placebo delivered via subcutaneous administration twice per week for a total of 9 doses
